description.narrative:
In 2007 the UNFPA launched the Global Programme To Enhance Reproductive Health Commodity Security (GPRHCS) to create a structure that works beyond ad hoc reactions, when it comes to the provision of essential supplies, among these contraception. A total of 50 million DKK has been granted for the period 2012-2014.
GPRHCS is the solution to the sustained need for a reliable supply of contraception, medicine and equipment in the developing countries. Such a supply is vital in achieving the Millennium Development Goals regarding universal access to reproductive health. GPRHCS focuses on quality control, procurement, and building of national logistical capacity to ensure that the commodities reach even the most desolate areas. As a part of the programme, UNFPA assists governments with integrating reproductive health commodities in national plans and programmes, and assists with strengthening the delivery systems, including the distribution of condoms, procurement of commodities, capacity building and training. Denmark puts emphasis on the programme's focus on building of distributive capacity for condoms - male/female -, and on security of supply.
